definition: to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove

sentences.english: The pine tree moves in the wind.
Spray drift is one of the most important indexes evaluating spray quality.
sentences.chinese: 飘移是评价液体农药喷洒质量的重要指标。

sentences.english: Ideally the throttle should then be re-applied to keep the car sliding.
sentences.chinese: 理想地油门控制应该再次使用以保持车辆的飘移。

sentences.english: His beard moves in the wind.
A minute, I must kiss the white clouds, lets each cloud cotton wool drift for me.
sentences.chinese: 一分钟，我要亲吻白云，让每一朵云絮为我飘移。

sentences.english: Bing Heqi with the ice in the Bay drift on the continuous erosion.
sentences.chinese: 它与冰河期的冰块，在湾内飘移时的不断冲刷有关。

definition: to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to turn/to go around a corner
to float/to drift/to wander/variant of 蜉蝣[fu2 you2]
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
to spin rapidly/to whirl around/(of time) to fly by
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
